segment.documentation: BGM, A segment specifying the functional use (e.g. sub-set) of the Generic Statistical Message and identifying the message sent.
DTM, A segment identifying dates which are relevant to the whole of the message.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments containing textual footnotes related to value lists or definitions of the content and structure of an array.

segment.documentation: FNT, A segment containing the unique identifier of the footnote.
FTX, A segment containing the text relevant to the footnote.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments identifying the sender and other relevant parties, their reference and the communication contact inside the corresponding organisations.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment identifying the name and address of a party.
IDE, A segment giving the identity number of the data transmitted as it is known by the organisation described in the NAD segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments giving contact information.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment identifying a person or a department for the party specified in the NAD segment and to whom communication should be directed.
COM, A segment providing a communication number for the contact identified in the CTA segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments containing either a coded or non coded list of items and related information.

segment.documentation: VLI, A segment identifying the value list.
DTM, A segment identifying the period of validity of the value list and, if the value list is a date list, then a date value in that list.
FTX, A segment containing text associated with the value list.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments containing the identification of an object related to the value list and the period of validity.

segment.documentation: IDE, A segment containing an identifier of an object related to the value list (e.g. a statistical nomenclature from which the codes in the list are derived, or a footnote).
DTM, A segment containing date information related to the identified object of the value list such as validity date or date range.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments containing the related identification number and the period of validity.

segment.documentation: GIR, A segment containing additional identifiers associated with the value list (e.g. for a statistical nomenclature this could be a revision number or level number).
DTM, A segment identifying the period of validity relating to the object identified in the GIR of this group.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments containing the codes or names in a value list.

segment.documentation: CDV, A segment identifying a particular value of a code.
FTX, A segment containing the textual description of the code. Multi-lingual definitions may be present in different occurrences of this segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments containing the identification of an object related to the code value and the period of validity.

segment.documentation: IDE, A segment containing an identifier of an object related to the code value (e.g. a related code list containing a list of code values for the code, or a footnote).
DTM, A segment identifying the period of validity relating to the object identification.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A group of segments specifying a statistical concept.

segment.documentation: STC, A segment identifying a statistical concept.
FTX, A segment containing the name, definition or description of the statistical concept.
IDE, A segment containing the identity of a footnote relevant to the statistical concept.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A group of segments which identifies and defines the structure of an array.

segment.documentation: ASI, A segment containing the unique identifier of the array structure.
GEI, A segment containing a processing indicator associated with the array structure.
FTX, A segment containing a name/title or description of the structure of an array.
IDE, A segment containing the identity of a footnote relevant to the structure.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 11: A group of segments which defines the structure of an array.

segment.documentation: SCD, A segment that defines a statistical concept or other object (such as a value list) used by an array and its position in the array.
ATT, A segment containing an attribute that further defines the structure component (e.g. type of value, type of measurement, etc.).

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 12: A group of segments identifying a value list or a value in a value list which is used by the statistical concept.

segment.documentation: IDE, A segment identifying the value list or value.
ATT, A segment containing an attribute that further defines the value (e.g. type of value, type of measurement etc.).
DTM, A segment identifying period of validity of the value list or other dates relevant to the value list.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 13: A group of segments identifying the data set, its status, the source of the data, the array data itself, the structure definition of the data set and definition of the scope of the data and local values, details on the originator of a data, and footnotes associated with the array data.

segment.documentation: DSI, A segment containing the unique identifier of the data set.
STS, A segment containing information on the status of the information in the data set, e.g. its elaboration or privacy status.
DTM, A segment identifying a date relevant to the data set, e.g. date of original elaboration.
FTX, A segment containing a textual description of the data set.
GIR, A segment containing additional identifiers associated with the data set (e.g. identification of the source or destination of the data in the data set).

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 14: A group of segments containing an identifier relevant to the data set, a processing indicator and a date.

segment.documentation: IDE, A segment containing an identifier relevant to the data set, such as the scope or structure definition used by the data set.
GEI, A segment containing a processing indicator associated with the array data.
DTM, A segment identifying a date relevant to the identity e.g. date relating to the scope of the data.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 15: A group of segments containing the codes or names in a value list that are relevant to the object identified in the IDE segment of the group e.g. one or more codes that specify the scope of the data set.

segment.documentation: CDV, A segment identifying a particular value of a code.
FTX, A segment containing the textual description of the code. Multi-lingual definitions may be present in different occurrences of this segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 16: A group of segments which identifies a structure component of the array and defines attributes or codes which are local to the data set identified in the DSI segment.

segment.documentation: SCD, A segment that identifies the structure component.
ATT, A segment containing an attribute that further defines the structure component (e.g. type of value, type of measurement etc.).
DTM, A segment specifying a date relevant to the structure component e.g. a date for time series data.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 17: A group of segments containing the codes or names in a value list that are relevant to the structure component identified in the SCD segment.

segment.documentation: CDV, A segment identifying a particular value of a code.
FTX, A segment containing the textual description of the code. Multi-lingual definitions may be present in different occurrences of this segment.
ARR, A segment containing the data in the data set.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 18: A group of segments identifying the department and contact person within the sending organisation responsible for a particular aspect of the data set (e.g. compilation).

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment identifying a particular department in an organisation responsible for the data set.
IDE, A segment containing an identifier used by the sender or receiver to identify the data set.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 19: A group of segments giving contact information.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment identifying a person or a department for the party specified in the NAD segment and to whom communication should be directed.
COM, A segment providing a communication number for the contact identified in the CTA segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 20: A group of segments identifying the location in the data set to which a footnote is relevant.

segment.documentation: FNS, A segment identifying a set of footnotes, which are either defined in this group or have been defined previously.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 21: A group of segments identifying the scope of the footnote, the location in the data set to which a footnote is relevant, and the identity number of that footnote.

segment.documentation: REL, A segment defining the scope of a footnote in terms of the relationship between the data in the ARR segment in segment group 22 and the data in the ARR segment in segment group 13.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 22: A group of segments which identifies the set of values in the array to which the footnotes or attributes apply, and which give the data value of the footnotes or attributes.

segment.documentation: ARR, A segment containing data values that identify the location in the data set to which a footnote is relevant.
FTX, A segment containing a footnote value.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 23: A group of segments which identify an attribute and give its value.

segment.documentation: IDE, A segment containing the identity of a footnote relevant to the data in the data set.
FTX, A segment containing an uncoded attribute value.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 24: A group of segments which specifies a coded attribute value and its name, description, or definition.

segment.documentation: CDV, A segment which specifies a coded attribute value.
FTX, A segment which specifies the name, description or definition of a coded attribute value.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 25: A group of segments containing textual footnotes related to data in the data set.

segment.documentation: FNT, A segment containing the unique identifier of the footnote.
FTX, A segment containing the text of the footnote.
